title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: The AIRFCAnalyzer tool should be designed to handle a broad spectrum of RFCs (functional, technical, architectural, etc.). The analysis criteria should include adherence to style guides, organizational standards, best practices, and potential regulatory compliance requirements. Desired outputs could be a summary report, actionable recommendations, annotated RFCs for clarity, and potential integration with existing systems like project management and version control tools. Consideration of scalability and flexibility is crucial, allowing the tool to handle increased workload and adapt to organizational changes. Machine learning techniques should be incorporated to enhance the analysis process. Break down the task into smaller, manageable subtasks before implementation. Document each step in detail for future reference. To ensure clarity, split the description into sections for 'Functional Requirements', 'Non-Functional Requirements', and 'Integration Points'. Once completed, update the rfc_state field to 'READY_FOR_IMPLEMENTATION' and assign the task to 'task-decomposer' for further decomposition.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the components, data flow, and integration points.

title: Develop Data Ingestion Pipeline
description: Implement a mechanism to ingest and preprocess RFCs from various sources.

title: Build Natural Language Processing (NLP) Module
description: Develop an NLP module to extract relevant information from RFCs and perform semantic analysis.

title: Implement Organizational Goal Alignment Analysis
description: Create a component to analyze the alignment of RFCs with the organization's goals and priorities.

title: Develop Impact Analysis Module
description: Build a module to assess the potential impacts of RFCs on various aspects of the organization, such as technical, financial, and operational.

title: Create User Interface
description: Design and implement a user-friendly interface for submitting RFCs and viewing analysis results.

title: Integrate Components and Modules
description: Integrate the various components and modules into a cohesive system.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the system is secure by implementing appropriate security measures, such as authentication, authorization, and data encryption.

title: Set up CI/CD Pipeline
description: Establish a Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipeline for automated testing, building, and deployment.

title: Conduct System Testing
description: Perform comprehensive testing of the AIRFCAnalyzer tool, including functional, integration, and performance testing.

title: Deploy to Production Environment
description: Deploy the AIRFCAnalyzer tool to the production environment and monitor its performance.

title: Create User Documentation
description: Develop comprehensive user documentation, including installation guides, user manuals, and troubleshooting guides.
